content.description:
Pitch 1  5.11b.  Climb the left-facing corner (5.10) to where it peters out, then clip a bolt and make a thin face move to gain a belay.

Pitch 2  5.9+.  Ascend the right-facing corner past its end to a groove and belay there.

Pitch 3  - Climb up and right on along sometimes runout pitch to the top anchor on

Sunshine Route

.
content.location:
This route is just to the right of

Shining Path

.

content.description:
Pitch 1  work leftwards along a ramp sort of system past a 5.8 corner to a belay ledge.  This is sometimes done as just one pitch.

Pitch 2  5.10a (9 R). Diagonal a bit leftwards along a groove to a bolt and belay at the base of an obtuse left facing corner.

Pitch 3  climb up the corner, then run it out on fairly easy terrain to the first bolt and up the steeper bit to the top.
content.location:
This is located to the right of

Tree Route

below an obvious, big, horizontal roof.

content.description:
Pitch 1  5.8. Climb the chimney to the ledge, then go up the corner to where the big, right-angling slash cuts across the face.

Pitch 2  5.7. Ascend a left-facing corner.

Pitch 3  5.8 R.  Go up the corner to where it fades for a bit, then go across the slab to belay where the corner picks back up.

Pitch 4  5.7.  Climb on up the corner in one or two pitches to the top.
content.location: This is located on the far right side of Sunshine Dome.

content.description: This is an immaculate, sharp, pure, splitter, finger crack. It's as good of a splitter as the Bishop finger crack and a better splitter than Sphinx. It's short, approx the same height as Soft Parade in Vedauwoo, about the same rating, too. It is actually longer than 40 feet (60 maybe), but the top 20 is utterly loose and easy choss, not worth climbing. When I can, I'm going to put an anchor there. Until then, you can down-aid the route.
content.protection: 1 blue TCU, 1 green Alien, 2 yellow Aliens, 2 red Aliens, one orange, and one purple. Use your own judgment.
content.location: This is down and north from the furthest left side of the Sunshine Dome. It looks too small to jam at first glance, walk closer and it opens up. Hard to miss.

content.description:
Pitch 1  5.9.  Chase the left-trending arch up to a belay spot where it sort of breaks apart.

Pitcgh 2  5.10a. Continue up the arch to a sling belay.

Pitch 3  5.9. Do the same as pitch two, up and angling left in the arch.

Pitch 4 - 5.9. Go on up the arch to the end.
content.location: This is located in the arch/corner system to the left of the big roof.

climbs.name: Shining Path
climbs.fa: Ken Trout, Kirk Miller, David Kozak, and Peter Prandoni

content.description:
500 feet to the right of

Heart of Darkness

is a line of bolts leading up to a left-facing flake. Belay near the top of the flake. Face climb up and right through the crux to another left-facing corner. Belay halfway up the corner. Continue up, switching cracks when they run out. Belay next to a big roof then climb past the bolt and up the dihedral to the top.

Climb the somewhat vegetated crack about 100 feet right of

French Curve

.  Belay on the slab below the roof.  Continue up the 5.11 slab to the roof, pull through and face climb the 5.12, RP protected seam to its end.  Belay on a scenic dike stance.  Wander up the sparsely bolted face and run it out to the top.
content.protection: Standard rack, double set of RPs with extra #s 2-4.

content.description: Right-facing dihedral on left side of dome, 150 ft. Scramble to top.
